body.p: SFAS 157 defines non‑performance risk as the risk that an obligation will not be fulfilled and indicates that it affects the fair value of a liability. Non‑performance risk includes but may not be limited to the reporting entity’s own credit risk. In comparison, IFRSs do not use the term non‑performance risk in discussing the fair value of a liability. However, IAS 39 requires the fair value of a financial liability to reflect its credit risk. Although the words are different, the boards believe that the underlying concepts are essentially the same.
